de.japi

Class Japi2

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.japi.Japi2

  • public class Japi2
extends java.lang.Object
    The main class of the JAPI2 kernel, which manages all tasks and handles all requests of the JAPI2 kernel. This class is the JVM entrance point.

    The main use cases which are handled by this class are:

    • setting up a ServerSocket to accept new connections
    • accepting new connections to the JAPI2 kernel and forward them to a dedicated Japi2Session which is responsponsible for incomming requests from this connection
    • running all Japi2Sessions in a ThreadPool to save performance and bound the number of parallel working threads
    • supports rudimentary logging features through the method debug(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...)
    • blocks remote connections if only local connections should be accepted
    • provides a tray icon through Japi2Tray to enable the user to manage the JAPI2 kernel (e.g. quit it, set connection policy, ...)
    • provides a storage for messages keys used to display user messages with in the right language. See getString(java.lang.String)

    • Field Summary

      static boolean DEVELOPER
      Iff true the method debug(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...) will print debug messages.

        Tests if the logging is paused.
        Returns:

      • start

        public void start(int port)
        Tries to start the JAPI2 kernel at the specified port. If this fails the JVM is terminated.
        Parameters:
        port - to let the ServerSocket listen on.

      • exit

        public void exit()
        Exits this application by closing / releasing all ressourced and then exiting the JVM by System.exit(int) with status 0.

      • debug

        public final void debug(java.lang.String msg,
                        java.lang.Object... args)
        Prints a debug message iff the DEVELOPER field is set to true. Additional arguments can be inserted into the message string by using placeholders. A placeholder, e.g. {0}, consists of an index number in-between two brackets. The given index is the index of the object in the args array which should be inserted at this location.
        Parameters:
        msg - message to print with placeholders if needed.
        args - arguments to place in the msg string at the corresponding placeholders to form a debug message.

      • inArray

        public static <T> boolean inArray(T needle,
                                  T... haystack)
        Tests if a value is contained in an array.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the value to check.
        Parameters:

        haystack - the array of values to check if needle is contained.
        Returns:

      • getInstance

        public static final Japi2 getInstance()
        Returns the instance of this class. Since this class implements the singelton pattern only one instance can exist during runtime.
        Returns:
        The Japi2 instance, never null.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main entrance point to launch the JAPI kernel. Possible commandline arguments are: 
          [0 - 65535]     Number of port on which the JAPI2 kernel listens for
                  clients. If an invalid number is given or the argument
                  is missing, the value Japi2Constants#JAPI_PORT
                  is used instead.
 
  -d              Exteneded debug mode is enabled. Beside the optinal
                  JAPI logging - which is bound to a session - other
                  debug messages are printed out on the stdio.
 
  -o              Turns the optimized rendering on. This means that 
                  graphic objects use anti-alias and some components will
                  use some modernized look and feel in comparsion to the
                  JAPI kernel 1.0.9. See Japi2SevenSegment
                  component for example.
 
  -l:[iso639]     Sets the locale for messages of the JAPI2 kernel. The
                  placeholder "iso639" expects an ISO 639 alpha-2 key to
                  identify the desired locale. By example "de" will stand
                  for German and "en" for English.
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments.
